articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Match for Examining Women's Football of National Sports Team to Participate in 17th Asian Games
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Match for Examining Women's Football of National Sports Team to Participate in 17th Asian Games
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, guided a match for examining the women's football of the National Sports Team which will take part in the 17th Asian Games.
					 The National Sports Team played the match with the April 25 Team.
					
					 It trounced its rival 8:0.
					
					 He expressed satisfaction over the fact that the women's footballers of the National Sports Team displayed team spirit, fair play and persevering fighting spirit and gave an instruction to bring the football technique on a higher level by rounding off the sports technique, tactical system and the training method of Korean style.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the women's footballers of the National Sports Team would fully display the dignity and honor of Juche Korea in the international games to be held in the future by putting greater spurs to training.
					
					 Among the spectators were Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior officials of the party and army and service personnel of the KPA.

articles.title: DPRK Expresses Its Will to Make Every Possible Effort to Preserve Peace and Security in Asia
articles.content:
DPRK Expresses Its Will to Make Every Possible Effort to Preserve Peace and Security in Asia
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, head of the DPRK delegation to the 21st ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum, made a speech on Aug. 10.
					 The situation prevailing on the Korean peninsula greatly affects the preservation of the peace and security in Asia, he said, and continued:
					
					 The situation on the peninsula remains serious.
					
					 The escalation of the tensions there is not helpful to us.
					
					 Nevertheless, there are some people who do not know who should be forced to restraint oneself to defuse the tensions.
					
					 Some people consider the DPRK's access to nukes as a factor of escalating the tensions, but it was not its choice.
					
					 The DPRK's decision to have access to nuclear deterrent was the one it was compelled to make due to the U.S. hostile policy, ceaseless military pressure and nuclear threat that lasted for more than half a century since its founding.
					
					 Our nukes are the war deterrence in the true sense of the words.
					
					 Some people claim that the rocket firing drills of the army of the DPRK escalate the tensions but they had better understand, to begin with, which side stages decisively larger-scale and more frequent military drills to threaten the other side.
					
					 The joint military drills being staged by the U.S. in south Korea are extremely provocative in their nature and go beyond in their tolerance limit in the danger of war. The recent joint military drills involved landing, air strikes and commando operations to "occupy Pyongyang".
					
					 In order to defuse the tensions, the DPRK government put forward proposals calling for stopping each other's military hostilities several times this year alone and has made efforts to do so.
					
					 However, the U.S. has not yet responded to them.
					
					 It is long since the DPRK put forward more fundamental ways for defusing the war danger on the peninsula and in its vicinity and ensuring lasting peace.
					
					 In the belief that to defuse the tensions on the peninsula and reunify the country by federal formula is the way of substantially contributing to the peace and security in Asia, the DPRK will make every possible sincere effort to do so.

articles.title: Myanmar President Meets DPRK Government Delegation
articles.content:
Myanmar President Meets DPRK Government Delegation
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Myanmar government supports the domestic and foreign policies of the party and government of the DPRK for peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the region and hopes for boosting the friendly relations between the two countries.
					 Thein Sein, president of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar, said while having a talk with the DPRK government delegation headed by Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong on a visit to Myanmar on Aug. 11.
					
					 He warmly congratulated HE Kim Jong Un upon his reelection as first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK thanks to the absolute trust of all the Korean people.
					
					 He sincerely wished Kim Jong Un great success in the work for defending the sovereignty of the country and achieving its prosperity. He said he was pleased that Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to developing the friendly relations with Myanmar.
					
					 Present there were the minister of Defense, the minister of Foreign Affairs, the minister of Industry, the minister of Information and others of Myanmar and the DPRK ambassador to Myanmar and a staff member of his embassy.

articles.title: Talks between FMs of DPRK and Myanmar
articles.content:
Talks between FMs of DPRK and Myanmar
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Talks between DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, head of the DPRK government delegation on a visit to Myanmar, and Wunna Maung Lwin, foreign minister of Myanmar, took place at the building of the Foreign Ministry on Monday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were the members of the delegation, the DPRK ambassador to Myanmar and his embassy official and from the Myanmar side the director general for Political Affairs, the director general for Protocol and vice director general for International Organizations and Economic Affairs of the ministry.
					
					 The talks discussed the issues of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in various fields.

articles.title: Speaker of Myanmar Parliament Meets DPRK Government Delegation
articles.content:
Speaker of Myanmar Parliament Meets DPRK Government Delegation
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Shwe Mann, chairman of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar and speaker of the Parliament of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar, met and had a talk with the DPRK government delegation headed by Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong on a visit to Myanmar at the building of the Parliament on Monday.
					 He said he would make positive efforts to boost the bilateral relations in the future, too. He expressed the will to develop the relations between the Workers' Party of Korea and the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar. 
					
					 Present there were the deputy speaker of the Lower House and other officials concerned of Myanmar, the DPRK ambassador to Myanmar and a staff member of his embassy.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, had a talk with Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kang Sok Ju Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Kang Sok Ju Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Kang Sok Ju, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, had a talk with Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, on Tuesday.

articles.title: DPRK Soccer Team Defeats S. Korean Team 3:1
articles.content:
DPRK Soccer Team Defeats S. Korean Team 3:1
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK soccer team defeated the south Korean team 3:1 in the semifinals of the 2014 Asian U-14 Soccer Championship and advanced into the finals.
					 The championship started in Iran on August 4. It brought together players from eight countries including the DPRK, Thailand, Tajikistan and Iraq. 
					
					 They were divided into two groups for group league matches. The DPRK belonged to Group A together with Saudi Arabia, Iran and East Timor.
					
					 It beat the Saudi Arabian team 2:0, Iranian team 1:0 and drew with East Timor 2:2, placing first in the group to advance into semi-finals.
					
					 The finals will be held on August 13.

articles.title: Pyongyang Carpet Factory Marks Its Diamond Anniversary
articles.content:
Pyongyang Carpet Factory Marks Its Diamond Anniversary
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Carpet Factory marked the 60th anniversary of its founding.
					 It is a precious factory of the country established by President Kim Il Sung and face-lifted by leader Kim Jong Il in the 1970s when the foundations for carrying forward the Juche cause were being laid down.
					
					 Seeing handicrafts made by the Pyongyang Handicraft Works, the predecessor of the factory, on August 13, Juche 43 (1954), the President brightly indicated the road of the development of the national handicraft and wisely led the factory to successfully manufacture handicrafts as required by the times.
					
					 Kim Jong Il saw to it that the carpet production process was newly arranged in the factory and the factory was renamed the Pyongyang Carpet Factory. He significantly instituted the day of the founding of the factory, leading it to add shines to the immortal leadership exploits of the President.
					
					 The workers and officials of the factory have produced various kinds of carpets needed for the grand monumental structures of the country in a responsible manner during the past six decades and strengthened the material and technological foundation for the development of the nation's carpet industry by accelerating the modernization of the production processes.
					
					 A meeting marking the 60th anniversary of the factory took place Tuesday.
					
					 Read out at the meeting was a congratulatory message sent by the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea to the workers, technicians and officials of the factory.

articles.title: Supplementary Nutritive Compound for Mushroom Developed
articles.content:
Supplementary Nutritive Compound for Mushroom Developed
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Central Mushroom Research Institute under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has recently developed supplementary nutritive compound for cultivating mushroom.
					 The compound helps promote the fermentation of substrate and enrich nutrients, thus bringing about a sharp increase in mushroom production.
					
					 The institute also perfected the technical process to put the production of substrate and fungi on a standard and specific basis.

articles.title: Chonji Lubricant Factory
articles.content:
Chonji Lubricant Factory
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Chonji Lubricant Factory is the key lubricant-maker in the DPRK.
					 Its production processes have been put on an automated, unmanned and IT basis with the complete establishment of computer integrated manufacturing (CIM) system. Those processes were awarded with the state quality authentication.
					
					 The factory is producing over 260 kinds of lubricant and grease, which are highly competent in foreign markets. And it also makes various kinds of lubricant containers and consumer goods with locally available raw materials.
					
					 All its lubricants with the ISO standards have been proved successful in the bids sponsored by the OPEC.
					
					 The factory's compound is resembled to a park for flower beds in lawns, a fish pond, deer cage and various species of trees like ginkgo nut, persimmon, grape and dwarf apple.
					
					Its greenery area covers more than 22,000 square meters.

articles.title: National Liberation War Based on Guerilla Warfare
articles.content:
National Liberation War Based on Guerilla Warfare
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung had made all his efforts to find the method of armed struggle fit for the specific situation in Korea from the first days of his revolutionary activities. 
					 At the Mingyuegou Meeting held in December Juche 20 (1931), Kim Il Sung set forth the unique military strategic idea that the anti-Japanese armed struggle should be based on guerilla warfare.
					
					 It was a great decision that he adopted the guerilla warfare as the principal method of struggle for national liberation war against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The President regarded all Koreans' active participation in the warfare and their support to it as the fundamental condition for the victory in the guerilla warfare.
					
					 Thanks to this idea, the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, which the Japanese imperialists called a "drop in the ocean", could lay a firm mass foundation for the armed struggle, strengthen the kinship with popular masses during the guerilla warfare and thus liberate the country from the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists under the leadership of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 During the anti-Japanese revolutionary war, the guerilla warfare fully showed its validity and efficiency as a method of armed struggle to destroy the powerful imperialists' army by means of ideological and tactical superiority.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Arms Buildup in Asia-Pacific Region
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Arms Buildup in Asia-Pacific Region
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the U.S. Defense Department made public a plan to massively deploy such warships as new type stealth destroyers, coastal combat ships and landing craft in the Asia-Pacific region. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard: Through the announcement of this plan the U.S. completely threw off its mask of an "apostle of peace." 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 A scrutiny into the causes of the outbreak of the First and Second World Wars suggests that the frantic arms buildup in various imperialist states was one of the factors of those wars.
					
					 The successive U.S. administrations have openly advocated "achieving peace by use of force."
					
					 All rulers of the U.S. including Reagan, Clinton and Bush adopted "achieving peace by use of force" as a policy. The same is true of Obama.
					
					 "Achieving peace by use of force" touted by the U.S. means, in essence, its domination of the world by force.
					
					 But it is facing obstacles. China and various other regional powers are increasing their influence in political, economic and military and other fields. 
					
					 That was why the U.S. advanced the pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy the keynote of which is the massive arms buildup a few years back.
					
					 The strategy is a dangerous one of confrontation and a Cold War strategy aimed to hold a military edge over China and other big powers in the Asia-Pacific region and lay a siege to those countries in a bid to contain them and realize its scenario to dominate the region.
					
					 These reckless acts of the U.S. to realize its hegemonic ambition will inevitably deepen the confrontation and antagonism between China and the U.S. and strain the situation in the region.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Authorities' DPRK-targeted Joint Military Drills under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Authorities' DPRK-targeted Joint Military Drills under Fire
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Papers here Tuesday carry articles blasting the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet military warmongers for going to stage large-scale Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drills targeting against the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun in an article says that UFG is an unpardonable military provocation against the DPRK as it is a revelation of the sinister scenario to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK.
					
					 This scenario to lead their military pressure upon the DPRK to an adventurous preemptive nuclear strike at it has already been disclosed, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Who can vouch that the warmongers at home and abroad will not escalate their offensive drills into actual battles while staging them with the involvement of huge forces and sophisticated nuclear strike means enough to wage a large-scale war?
					
					 This is becoming more likely under the situation where they are going to kick off UFG against the backdrop of the prevailing unprecedented tensions.
					
					 The prevailing situation goes to prove that the warmongers at home and abroad have already made the outbreak of a nuclear war an established fact and are putting spurs to it.
					
					 If a new war breaks out on the Korean peninsula due to the aggressors' reckless military provocations, it will spill over into an all-out nuclear war.
					
					 The DPRK can never remain a passive onlooker to the reckless moves of the puppet military gangsters to ignite a nuclear war while posing a serious military threat to it in conclusion with foreign forces.
					
					 Minju Joson notes in a commentary: It is quite possible for the U.S. to ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK as the former is steeped in the inveterate repugnance towards the latter and blinded with wild ambition for world domination. But the U.S. would be well advised to stop its rash acts, properly understanding who its rival is.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Conniving at Violence in Army
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Conniving at Violence in Army
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Christian Presbyterian Church of south Korea in a commentary blamed the puppet authorities for the death of a private first class of the army, according to CBS of south Korea on Monday.
					 The commentary said the blame for the death of the private rests with the present "government" including the Defense Ministry which has connived at the harsh violence in the army.
					
					 It stressed the need to clearly understand the problems in the upper echelon of the military and the ruling quarters and take practical measures.

articles.title: More Violent Acts Disclosed in S. Korean Puppet Army
articles.content:
More Violent Acts Disclosed in S. Korean Puppet Army
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Harsh acts including violence were disclosed in succession in the south Korean puppet army, according to Yonhap News of south Korea on August 9.
					 A senior private of the 52nd Division of the puppet army committed violence on a private first class on August 3.
					
					 He has beat junior soldiers more than 80 times since July, last year and committed sexual assaults.
					
					 Meanwhile, soldiers shot themselves to death in the 31st Division last year. It has been recently confirmed that the main cause is that they abandoned their lives due to violence and abuses by superiors.

articles.title: Probe into Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster Demanded
articles.content:
Probe into Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster Demanded
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Actions demanding a probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster are unabated in Seoul, according to KBS, MBC and CBS of south Korea.
					 More than 70 bereaved family members of the ferry Sewol disaster on August 8 attempted to enter the "National Assembly" building in protest against the agreement reached by the puppet political camp turning down their demand for the institution of a special law on the ferry Sewol.
					
					 They offered strong resistance against the riot police.
					
					 Next day bereaved families stormed the building of an opposition party and launched an indefinite sit-in strike.
					
					 The Measure Committee of the Families of Victims, Missing Persons and Survivors of the Ferry Sewol Sinking Accident of south Korea held a meeting at Kwanghwamun square on August 9 with at least 1 800 citizens attending. It held that the special law should contain the rights to investigate and indict those responsible for the tragedy for a proper probe into the truth about it. 
					
					 Members of the Moviemen's Association for the Institution of the Special Law of the Ferry Sewol held a press conference at Kwanghwamun square at which they declared that they would stage a hunger strike till the truth about the disaster is probed.
					
					 Students also attempted to occupy the office of the floor leader of an opposition party on August 9.

articles.title: IS Was Involved in Ferry Sewol Disaster: S. Korean Organizations
articles.content:
IS Was Involved in Ferry Sewol Disaster: S. Korean Organizations
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Measure Committee of the Families of Victims, Missing Persons and Survivors of the Ferry Sewol Sinking Accident and the Fact-finding Group of Defence Counsel of south Korea held a press conference in Kwanghwamun, Seoul on August 7 and demanded a clarification of the collusion between the puppet Intelligence Service (IS) and the ferry Sewol.
					 At the press conference speakers said it was confirmed that 100-point report on the inspection of the ferry was included in the instructions from IS that were found in a computer of the ferry.
					
					 The IS presented relevant data two times but only discrepancies and inconsistency were found, increasing doubt, they noted.
					
					 People suspected that the IS had been involved in the ferry disaster but the inside story has not yet been disclosed, they said.
					
					 They demanded that the "government" and the political camp give a proper answer to it.

articles.title: Demo Staged in S. Korea in Demand of Resignation of Kim Kwan Jin
articles.content:
Demo Staged in S. Korea in Demand of Resignation of Kim Kwan Jin
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Members of the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea staged a demonstration outside Chongwadae on Aug. 6 in demand of the resignation of puppet military gangster Kim Kwan Jin, chief of the security office of Chongwadae.
					 People are stunned by the disclosure of the truth about the death of a private in the puppet army, demonstrators said.
					
					 Group violence and harsh treatment of him are unimaginable but the military's attitude toward his death is more shocking, they deplored.
					
					 Kim Kwan Jin, the then minister of Defense, received a detailed report on the death but did not take any step, they charged.
					
					 They demanded Kim resign and be punished as he is chiefly responsible for his death.

articles.title: DPRK Never Makes Empty Talk: Syrian Paper
articles.content:
DPRK Never Makes Empty Talk: Syrian Paper
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Syrian paper Al Nour on Aug. 5 carried an article titled "DPRK, Victory Day" on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The U.S. started the Korean War on June 25, 1950, and during the three-year war it suffered losses nearly 2.3 times that it sustained during the Pacific War, a shameful defeat for the first time in its history of aggression, says the paper, and continued:
					
					 July 27, 1953, when the U.S. inked the armistice agreement, a surrender document, was a great victory day for the Korean people as they shattered to smithereens the myth of the U.S. imperialists' "mightiness" and defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country.
					
					 The U.S. has escalated the tensions on the Korean peninsula after the war through ceaseless military provocations, far from drawing a due lesson from the Korean War.
					
					 The U.S. together with the south Korean regime has recently staged war drills of aggression on the Korean peninsula and in its vicinity with huge armed forces of aggression involved.
					
					 The recent firing of tactical rockets by the DPRK to cope with the provocations by the U.S. getting undisguised as the days go by was a striking example of the decisive counter-measures of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK, which never makes an empty talk, will frustrate every provocation of the U.S. and all other hostile forces.
					
					 July 27 will always shine along with the successive victories in the confrontation with the U.S.

articles.title: British Organizations Denounce Projected U.S.-S. Korea Nuclear War Drills
articles.content:
British Organizations Denounce Projected U.S.-S. Korea Nuclear War Drills
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The progressive organizations of Britain including the Korean Friendship Association UK made public a joint statement on August 2. It supported the statement of the spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea which calls for canceling the plan of Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises.
					 It said:
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggressors, sworn enemy of the Korean people, and their fascist stooge south Korean puppet forces are working hard to stage the Ulji Freedom Guardian from mid August.
					
					 They are openly claiming that "tailored deterrence strategy" would be formally applied to the exercises.
					
					 All facts go to prove the sinister aim of the U.S. imperialists to ignite a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has made crucial peaceful proposals one after another to improve the inter-Korean relations and took concrete measures but the south Korean puppet forces, hell-bent on anti-DPRK war exercises together with their American master, have refused to accept the proposals.
					
					 The projected war exercises are a serious insult to the DPRK and an act of gravely threatening global peace.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked in Nigeria, Guinea
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked in Nigeria, Guinea
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A lecture, book exhibition and film show were held in Nigeria and a lecture and film show in Guinea on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of the liberation of Korea.
					 On display at the venue of the book exhibition were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un, and books introducing service personnel and all other people of the DPRK in their efforts to build a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Korean films shown included "Arms of Korea".
					
					 It was Kim Il Sung who liberated the Korean nation from the fate of colonial slaves of the Japanese imperialists, said the chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 He continued:
					
					 Such legends as "General Kim Il Sung employs the art of shortening distance" and "The Korean People's Revolutionary Army appears from nowhere and disappears into nowhere" spread throughout the Japanese people as well as the Korean people.
					
					 The Korean people fought the anti-Japanese war bravely under his leadership, looking up to him as the sun of the nation and the savior of the liberation of Korea.
					
					 The feats performed by the President, the benevolent liberator of the nation, will always be remembered by the Korean people and the world progressives century after century.
					
					 The permanent secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture of Yobe State, Nigeria, said that the feats the President performed by liberating the country through the armed struggle will go down in the history of the world anti-imperialist national liberation.
					
					 The chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, Guinea, noted that the President, who brought about a historic event of the liberation of the country, is highly lauded as a national liberator, and is always remembered by the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Serbian Political Party on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Serbian Political Party on Its Website
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Only Victory and Glory Are in Store for Us who Are Advancing under the Unfurled Flag Bearing the Immortal Beaming Images of the Great Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il" was posted by the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia on its website on August 7.
					 The speech, made by him at the banquet on August 25, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the Songun feats performed by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It calls for dynamically advancing to win a final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun started and successfully led by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige competencia de futbol femenino de seleccion nacional
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige competencia de futbol femenino de seleccion nacional
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio la competencia de examen de futbol femenino de la seleccion nacional que tomara parte en los XVII Juegos Asiaticos.
					En la competencia participaron la seleccion nacional y el equipo 25 de Abril.
					
					La primera vencio al segundo por 8:0.
					
					El Mariscal se mostro satisfecho de que las futbolistas de la seleccion nacional hayan demostrado el espiritu colectivista, nobles rasgos morales de juego y tenaz combatividad y dio las instrucciones para elevar a una etapa mas alta la tecnologia de futbol cumpliendo la tecnologia deportiva, sistema de tacticas y metodos de ejercicios al estilo coreano.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que las futbolistas de la seleccion nacional pondran de pleno manifiesto la dignidad y el honor de la Corea del Juche en los juegos internacionales a ser efectuados en el futuro acelerando mas los ejercicios.
					
					Le acompanaron en verla Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el ejercito junto con los militares del EPC.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong interviene en la reunion ministerial del foro regional de ASEAN
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong interviene en la reunion ministerial del foro regional de ASEAN
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- En la reunion ministerial del 21o Foro Regional de la Asociacion de Naciones del Sudeste Asiatico (ASEAN), el canciller Ri Su Yong, jefe de la delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, pronuncio el dia 10 un discurso.
					Es muy importante la posicion que ocupa la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana en preservar la paz y seguridad de Asia, adelanto Ri y prosiguio:
					
					Ahora es grave la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					La tensa situacion de esa zona no ayuda en nada a la RPDC.
					
					Sin embargo, algunas personas estan confundidas sin conocer a quien deben disuadir ahora para relajar la situacion.
					
					Algunos piensan que la posesion de armas nucleares por parte de la RPDC es factor de la agravacion de la situacion, pero esa no fue nuestra opcion.
					
					Nos vimos obligados a tomar la decision de preparar el disuasivo nuclear porque no pudimos aguantar mas la politica hostil, la presion militar y la amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. que no han parado durante mas de medio siglo despues de la fundacion de nuestro pais.
					
					Nuestras armas nucleares son, al pie de la letra, un medio disuasivo de la guerra.
					
					Otras personas dicen que el entrenamiento de lanzamiento de cohetes del Ejercito Popular de Corea agrava la situacion, pero ellas deberian observar primero de que parte son los ejercicios militares mas grandes, mas frecuentes y mas amenazantes.
					
					Los ejercicios militares conjuntos que EE.UU. desarrolla en el Sur de Corea pasan el limite tanto en su caracter provocativo como en la peligrosidad de estallido de guerra.
					
					Los ultimos simulacros se enfocan en el desembarco, el golpe aereo y la operacion de tropas especiales tomando como objetivo la "operacion de Pyongyang".
					
					Para relajar la situacion, el gobierno de la RPDC presento en varias ocasiones solo en este ano la propuesta de parar mutuamente el acto hostil militar entre ambas partes y se ha esforzado por ponerla en practica.
					
					Pero, no tenemos todavia la respuesta de la parte norteamericana.
					
					Presentamos ya hace mucho tiempo el remedio radical para eliminar el peligro de guerra y preservar la paz eterna en la Peninsula Coreana y sus periferias.
					
					Convencidos de que relajar la tension de la Peninsula Coreana y lograr la reunificacion mediante el sistema federal son el camino para contribuir realmente a la paz y seguridad de Asia, nos esforzaremos sinceramente en todo lo posible para ese fin.

articles.title: Gobierno de Myanmar apoya politica de RPDC
articles.content:
Gobierno de Myanmar apoya politica de RPDC
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente de Myanmar, Thein Sein, se reunio el dia 11 con la delegacion gubernamental de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por el canciller Ri Su Yong, de visita en este pais asiatico.
					En la ocasion el presidente dijo que el gobierno de Myanmar apoya la politica interna y externa del partido y gobierno de la RPDC para lograr la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region y desea ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises.
					
					Prosiguio que felicita calurosamente la reeleccion de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un como Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC por la absoluta confianza de todo el pueblo coreano.
					
					Subrayo que el desea de todo corazon a Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un grandes exitos en el trabajo para defender la soberania y la prosperidad del pais y esta agradecido de que el presta profunda atencion al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad con Myanmar.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el ministro de Defensa, el canciller, el ministro de Comercio, el ministro de Informacion y otros de Myanmar, el embajador y otro miembro de la sede diplomatica de la RPDC en este pais asiatico.

articles.title: Conversan cancilleres de Corea y Myanmar
articles.content:
Conversan cancilleres de Corea y Myanmar
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 11 en la sede del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores las conversaciones entre el canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, quien preside la delegacion gubernamental de visita en Myanmar, y su homologo de este pais, Wunna Maung Lwin.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion los miembros de la delegacion, el embajador y otro miembro de la sede diplomatica coreana en Myanmar por la parte coreana y por la contraparte, el director general para los Asuntos Politicos, el director general de Protocolo y el subdirector general para las Organizaciones Internacionales y Asuntos Economicos del MINREX.
					
					Fueron debatidos los problemas para ampliar y desarrollar en diversos dominios las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Shwe Mann se reune con la delegacion de RPDC
articles.content:
Shwe Mann se reune con la delegacion de RPDC
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Partido de Solidaridad y Desarrollo de la Union y del Parlamento de la Republica de la Union de Myanmar, Shwe Mann, departio el dia 11 en la sede del Parlamento con la delegacion gubernamental de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea presidida por el canciller Ri Su Yong, de visita en ese pais.
					En la ocasion, el presidente dijo que se esforzara tambien en el futuro por desarrollar las relaciones entre los dos paises y expreso la voluntad de ampliar y desarrolar las relaciones entre el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Partido de Solidaridad y Desarrollo de la Union de Myanmar.
					
					Asistieron a la ocasion el vicepresidente de la Camara de Representantes y otros funcionarios, el embajador y un funcionario de la sede diplomatica coreana en Myanmar.

articles.title: Equipo de RPDC avanza a la final del campeonato asiatico de futbol sub-14 de 2014
articles.content:
Equipo de RPDC avanza a la final del campeonato asiatico de futbol  sub-14 de 2014
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- La seleccion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea avanzo a la final del Campeonato Asiatico de Futbol sub-14 de 2014, iniciado el dia 4 en Iran, al doblegar al once surcoreano por 3:1 en la semifinal.
					En esta cita participan la RPDC, Tailandia, Tadjikistan, Irak y otros 4 paises y regiones.
					
					En las clasificatorias divididas en dos grupos, la RPDC compitio en el grupo A frente a Arabia Saudita, Iran y Timor del Este.
					
					Avanzo a las finales ocupando primer lugar en la zona A al vencer a Arabia Saudita e Iran por 2:0 y 1:0 y darse las tablas con el once de Timor del Este por 2:2.
					
					La final tendra lugar el dia 13.
